name: NPR
text:
In his new book, investigative journalist Dan Alexander assembles a detailed portrait of President Trump's business interests.

He says Trump has broken a number of vows he made about how he would conduct business while in office.
https://t.co/9VZxLvu0LK

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: The House passed a funding bill to keep the government running through Dec. 11 after it was delayed over a dispute on farm aid. The bill still needs Senate's approval and Trump's signature.
https://t.co/U49KyXNwBJ

name: NPR
text:
For about a century, big furniture companies have relied on the same business model for selling desks and chairs. But as the pandemic continues, the age of the home office is changing that. (@planetmoney)
https://t.co/b4MZ79jVQb

name: NPR
text:
President Trump says he has expanded a ban on racial sensitivity training to federal contractors after his administration instructed federal agencies to end such training earlier this month.
https://t.co/9u9PLQgsWd

name: NPR
text:
Facebook has taken down a network of China-based fake accounts whose posts included some content about the U.S. presidential election, but "gained almost no following" in the U.S.
https://t.co/Ra93s0o2zi

name: NPR
text:
The cast members of "Hamilton" remixed songs from the hit show's soundtrack to encourage voter participation this election ‚Äî laying out the stakes and the nitty-gritty of casting a ballot.
https://t.co/HBQasn2MAf

name: NPR
text:
Taiwan is not pursuing formal diplomatic ties with the U.S. for now, but there's "a lot" of room to strengthen relations, Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said after unprecedented visits by two senior U.S. officials.
https://t.co/up4qk5xEUS

name: NPR
text:
Yusuf Cat Stevens has remade "Tea for the Tillerman" 50 years after its release, with updates that include new lyrics, new instrumentation ‚Äî and singing along with his 22-year-old self on "Father And Son."

He spoke to NPR about how ‚Äî and why ‚Äî he did so.
https://t.co/8K6eZFX3ox

name: NPR
text:
Police have charged a high school student and the teen's parents with allegedly hosting a party of 50 students with underage drinking, which led to the town's high school delaying in-person classes out of concern for COVID-19.
https://t.co/gWaiEBlvvV

name: NPR
text:
Some experts think social media platforms should implement circuit breakers, modeled after the stock market, as a way to halt the amplification engines that can make false rumors go viral.
https://t.co/vqchMJnC6Q

name: NPR
text:
H.R. McMaster: "President Trump isn't the first president ‚Äî he's the third, actually, to suffer under the delusion that we can have a good relationship with Putin. We can make him change. He's going to become ... a nicer guy. He's really not."
https://t.co/qDKe703iGv

name: NPR
text:
In her new book, "Can't Even," writer Anne Helen Petersen argues that burnout isn't an individual problem ‚Äî it's a symptom of a labor crisis. She says burnout will only end by implementing sweeping policy changes.
https://t.co/V2lfSMrFvT

name: NPR
text: Millions of voters will be mailing in ballots for the first time this election season. @MilesParks and @NPRLifeKit‚Ä¶ https://t.co/s0TQL0Kj86

name: NPR
text:
To curb your people pleasing habit, try to:

üìà Observe how you spend your time and energy over a week
üíÜüèæ Understand your bandwidth, and learn to respect it
üëâ Learn the difference between desire and obligation
üõë Pause before you say yes (@NPRLifeKit)
https://t.co/9vHMTnqt6U

name: NPR
text:
Animals can feel. Is that enough for them to be given rights? A judge in Argentina had to decide. 

Listen to the story on our Spanish-language podcast, @radioambulante. https://t.co/k8dnoyp8W7

name: NPR
text:
Exclusive: A new national effort is underway to set up a COVID-19 dashboard for K-12 schools, where they can anonymously report their confirmed and suspected cases ‚Äî along with the safety strategies they're using.
https://t.co/qQiAWKhbiL

name: NPR
text:
Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has been discharged from a Berlin hospital after 32 days there ‚Äî 24 of them in intensive care ‚Äî following his poisoning by a Soviet-era nerve agent in Siberia.
https://t.co/9bqE7rKSBW

name: NPR
text: WATCH LIVE: Dr. Anthony Fauci, CDC Director Robert Redfield and other health experts are testifying before a Senate committee about the coronavirus response.  https://t.co/XUuM9I22ke

name: NPR
text:
Cindy McCain, the widow of Sen. John McCain, has become the latest prominent conservative to urge Republicans to cross party lines and support Joe Biden for president.
https://t.co/VlIhNuflKe

name: NPR
text:
Dr. Anthony Fauci and three other top federal officials are testifying before a Senate committee this morning about the U.S. response to the coronavirus pandemic.

Watch live ‚¨á
https://t.co/3dGuqFNsna

name: NPR
text:
On Friday, the late Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg will become the first woman to lie in state at the U.S. Capitol.
https://t.co/IkSeivaqMw
